question: Which one of the following materials is very hard and very ductile?
explanation: Nichrome has high melting point because it is very ductile. The metal is very hard and non-fragile. Nichrome is a non-magnetic alloy of nickel, chromium, and iron, usually used as a resistance wire. A common alloy is 80% nickel and 20% chromium, by mass. This alloying provide nichrome properties like hardness and ductility.
